questions.text: A 54-year-old male presents to the emergency department with sudden onset chest pain, palpitations, breathlessness, nausea and vomiting since the last 2 hours. There is no history of loss of consciousness. On examination, patient has BP = 100/40 mm Hg, PR = 56/min and RR = 21/min. Auscultation reveals 3/6 early systolic murmur in the mitral region and bibasilar crackles. Which additional finding do you expect to see on auscultation of this patient?

A 19-year-old nulligravid woman comes to your clinic for emergency contraception. The condom broke during sexual intercourse 2 days ago and she does not desire to be pregnant. There is no history of pelvic pain or sexually transmitted infections in the past. Which of the following is the most effective emergency contraceptive method for this patient?

A 37-year-old female with no existing co-morbidities undergoes a laparoscopic cholecystectomy. During the surgery, there is a sudden drop in EtCO2 with hypotension and tachycardia. The airway pressure is normal. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following coagulation factors decreases in pregnancy?

A 62-year-old male presents to the medicine emergency with altered consciousness and headache since the past 12 hours. On examination, he has high grade fever, nuchal rigidity with no focal neurological deficits. BP = 130/80 mm Hg and PR = 110/min. His previous reports indicate that he is HIV positive. You draw his blood cultures and start him on empiric antibiotic therapy. Which is the next best step in the management of this patient?

A 32-year-old female presents to you with features of schizophrenia. You start her on haloperidol. Which of the following is the mechanism of intracellular signaling of the receptor this drug acts on?

A 32-year-old female with prosthetic aortic valves presents to the office with a positive urine pregnancy test. Her LMP was 6 weeks ago. She is maintained on warfarin and has a previous history of baby born with Contradi syndrome. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Switch warfarin to low molecular weight heparin

options.label: B
options.text: Maintain patient on warfarin and do regular USGs to monitor fetus

questions.correct_answer: A. Switch warfarin to low molecular weight heparin

questions.text: Read the following statements regarding FGF-23. 1) Decreases renal phosphate excretion 2) Increases intestinal phosphate excretion 3) Produced by osteocytes 4) Increases PTH levels 5) Raised FGF-23 with normal phosphate is not an indication for phosphate binders in CKD Which of the following is/are not true about FGF-23?
A female is on Mala N for contraception. After the end of the ﬁrst strip, there was no withdrawal bleeding. What is the next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Start next cycle of tablets from 5th day

options.label: B
options.text: Start next cycle from next day

options.label: C
options.text: Urgent visit to hospital and check for pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: C. Urgent visit to hospital and check for pregnancy

questions.text: A 28-year-old female presents to the emergency with sudden onset right sided chest pain and shortness of breath since the last 1 hour. She is breathless at rest and cannot speak more than a few words at once. Her vitals are BP = 100/60 mm Hg, PR = 105/min, RR = 24/min and SpO2 = 92% on room air. She reveals that she has had 2 such episodes in the past as well. You get a chest X-ray done for this patient which is shown below. Which of the following is true about this woman’s condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Smoking increases the risk of acquiring this condition

options.label: C
options.text: It increases the risk of chylothorax

options.label: D
options.text: It involves the apical portion of the lungs

questions.correct_answer: C. It increases the risk of chylothorax

questions.text: A 21-year-old college student presents to the emergency with clinical features of sudden onset palpitations since the past 30 minutes. There is no history of loss of consciousness or chest pain. The patient does not take any medications except a daily salmeterol-fluticasone inhaler for asthma. His BP = 110/70 mm Hg and SpO2 = 97% on room air. His ECG is shown below. Which of the following is the next best step in the management of this patient?

A 25-year-old lady presents to you with 6 weeks amenorrhea with a positive urine pregnancy test and complain of vaginal bleeding. On examination, no abnormalities are noted. On USG, gestational sac is not visualized and there is no fluid in the pouch of Douglas. What is the next best step in management?
questions.correct_answer: C. Follow up with b -hCG levels

questions.text: One metabolic equivalent of task (MET) is equal to how much oxygen consumption?

Which of the following is/are true regarding the management of type II diabetes mellitus? 1. Saroglitazar is the drug of choice for diabetic dyslipidemia 2. HbA1c > 8% at presentation is an indication to start insulin 3. Target HbA1c < 6.5% 4. Linagliptin can be used in renal failure 5. Teplizumab is a new drug approved to delay its progression

A 61-year-old menopausal female presents to you with post-menopausal bleeding. She has a BMI of 36 kg/m2 and is hypertensive and diabetic. An endometrial sampling done reveals complex endometrial hyperplasia with atypia. What is the next step in management?
questions.correct_answer: C. Dilation and curettage with hysteroscopy

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents to your clinic with chronic pain and stiffness in both knees since the past 5 months. He also complains of tingling and numbness in his right hand. His blood pressure is 160/90 mm Hg. On examination, he has a protruding jaw and bilateral lower limb pitting edema. What is the next step in the diagnosis of this patient?
Which of the following structures are cut in mediolateral episiotomy? 1. Bulbospongiosus 2. Ischiocavernosus 3. Posterior vaginal wall 4. Levator ani
What is the window period for thrombolysis in ischemic stroke?

Read the following statements. 1. Magnesium sulphate is given to prevent seizures and lower blood pressure in pre-eclampsia. 2. Kassowitz law applies to secondary syphilis. 3. Manning’s score < 2 is 100% predictive of fetal acidemia. 4. In pre-eclampsia, sFlt-1 levels are increased. 5. D-dimer is the first investigation done in case of suspicion of pulmonary embolism in pregnancy. Which of the following statements are incorrect?

Read the following conditions. 1. Familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia 2. Chronic lithium use 3. Hyperthyroidism 4. Milk alkali syndrome 5. Vitamin D toxicity In how many of the above conditions is there increased osteoclast activity?

A 30-year-old man presents to the clinic with a history of fever, fatigue and malaise since the past 1 month. He has no other complaints. This is the third doctor he is visiting for this condition. His vitals include BP = 114/84 mm Hg, PR = 110/min and temperature = 101 ° F. His ESR & CRP were done last week and were slightly raised. However, his blood cultures, urine cultures and chest X-ray were all negative. Tri-dot and peripheral smear were also unremarkable. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

Read the following statements about congenital hypopituitarism. 1. Most commonly associated with Pit-1 defect 2. First hormone level to decrease is growth hormone 3. Can present with hypocortisolism and hypothyroidism 4. Normal height at birth 5. Associated with branchial cysts Which of the above statements are correct?
Which of the following is not a test of ovarian reserve?
Assertion: FEV1/FVC ratio is maintained in interstitial lung disease Reason: There is radial traction in the lower airways Read the two statements and choose the correct answer.

options.label: A
options.text: Assertion and reason are correct and reason is the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Assertion and reason are correct and reason is not the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is correct but reason is false

options.label: D
options.text: Reason is correct but assertion is false

questions.correct_answer: A. Assertion and reason are correct and reason is the correct explanation of the assertion

questions.text: A 6 year old boy gets hit on his arm with the ball while playing cricket. He instantly starts rubbing the area to reduce the pain. What is the mechanism behind it ?
Which of the following is not used in the management of hyperkalemia?
What is the frequency of stimulus in tetanic stimulation?
A 47-year-old male from Orissa presents to you with 102.9 F fever, chills and rigor. His PR = 98/min and BP = 106/78 mm Hg. Which of the following is least likely to be the diagnosis in this case?

A 29-year-old female presents to you with a week of high-grade fever, cough and coryza. Suspecting COVID-19, you get an RT-PCR done, which turns out to be positive. She is discharged home with supportive management. Five days later, she presents with yellowish discoloration of the sclera and dark yellow urine. She has no fever. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 24-year-old female presents to you at 10 weeks of amenorrhea with severe nausea and vomiting. On examination, the size of her uterus is consistent with 12-14 weeks gestation. Her USG is shown below. What is the next step in management?

A known patient of CKD presents to the emergency with vomiting stains. His ABG is done which shows pH = 7.4, HCO3 = 24 mEq/L, pCO2 = 40 mm Hg, Na = 145 mEq/L and Cl = 100 mEq/L. What is the acid-base anomaly in this case?

options.label: B
options.text: High anion gap metabolic acidosis + metabolic alkalosis

options.label: C
options.text: Normal anion gap metabolic acidosis + metabolic alkalosis

questions.correct_answer: B. High anion gap metabolic acidosis + metabolic alkalosis

questions.text: Which of the following extra-intestinal manifestations of inflammatory bowel disease does not correlate with disease severity?

A patient undergoes routine testing for hepatitis B, and this is what is found in his results. HBsAg = +ve HBeAg = -ve Anti-HBc IgG = + ve Anti-HBe = + ve What is the likely interpretation of the above findings?
Which if the following is the correct sequence of potency of anaesthetic agents?
Match the following.
Which of the following is not a cause of hypervolemic hyponatremia?
Which of the following is incorrect about the procedure of ABG?
What is the flow rate of fluid in the cannula shown below?
Identify the instrument shown below.

On investigating for infertility the male partner was found to have hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. Which of the following are associated with this condition? 1) Azoospermia/severe oligospermia 2) Low LH, low FSH 3) Low LH, high FSH 4) Low testosterone 5) Low prolactin level

Read the following statements. 1. In ectopic pregnancy, the hCG levels increase by 55%-65% over 48 hours which helps to differentiate it from missed abortion. 2. T-sign on USG is suggestive of diamniotic monochorionic twins. 3. The cut-off level to visualise gestational sac on TAS is 2000 IU/L. 4. Leuprolide is given in a pulsatile manner for the treatment of male infertility. 5. Cyclical pain is seen in Asherman’s syndrome Which of the above statements is/are true?

A 32-year-old woman presents to the office with inability to conceive for the last two years. She has had one child 5 years back which was a spontaneous conception. On examination, she has two 4 cm intramural fibroids. What is the next best step in management?
Arrange the investigations/procedures based on the POG at which they are performed from earliest to latest. 1. OGTT 2. Level 2 scan 3. Nuchal translucency scan 4. Amniocentesis
Which one of the following anti-cancer drugs acts during G2 phase of the cell cycle?

A 19-year-old sexually active female presents to you with copious foul smelling discharge per vaginum. It is associated with pruritus and dysuria. On per speculum examination, you see the following. Which of the following is not true about the condition?

options.label: B
options.text: The organism shows falling leaf motility on wet mount

options.label: D
options.text: Single dose secnidazole is used for its treatment

questions.correct_answer: B. The organism shows falling leaf motility on wet mount

questions.text: Which one of the following is an alpha 2 antagonist?

A 65-year-old female presented to the office with headache and toe pain which relieved with exposure to cold. On examination there is moderate splenomegaly. CBC revealed a Hb 11 g/dL and platelet count of 1,000,000/uL. The first line treatment in this patient would be –

Read the following statements regarding instrumental delivery. 1. For aftercoming head of breech, only forceps can be used but not vacuum. 2. In heart disease of pregnancy, vacuum delivery is preferred over forceps delivery. 3. Vacuum delivery is contraindicated before 37 weeks. 4. Abducens nerve palsy is seen more commonly with vacuum delivery. 5. Vacuum can be applied at 6 cm cervical dilation or more. Which of the above statements are incorrect?
Which one of the following drugs is useful in xerostomia due to Sjogren syndrome?

A 35-year-old female presents to you at 30 weeks of gestation for her first prenatal visit in this pregnancy. She has had a previous pregnancy with no complications and gave birth to a healthy baby at term at her home. Routine blood investigations revealed a blood group of A negative. You follow this up with an indirect Coombs test which comes out to be positive for a titre of 1:16. An MCA Doppler reveals flow velocity of 2 MoM. What is the next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Repeat indirect Coombs test after 4 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Follow up with MCA Doppler after 2 weeks

questions.text: Lifecycle stages of a fish tape worm given in this list. Choose the statement which contains the correct order. I. Plerocercoid larvae, II. Coracidium, III. Operculated egg, IV. Procercoid larvae

A 54-year-old female presents to the OPD with lower abdominal discomfort. You perform a TVS and visualize and adnexal mass. The mass is removed surgically, and the histopathological report shows the following picture. What is the tumour marker for this?

A 34-year-old female comes to the office due to inability to conceive. She and her husband have been having unprotected intercourse for the past 3 years. The husband’s semen analysis is normal. A Transabdominal USG reveals bilateral hydrosalpinx. What is the treatment of choice for this patient?
A 58-year-old woman presents with bleeding per vaginum since the past one month. A USG shows a small mass protruding into the uterine cavity with feeder vessel sign. What is the diagnosis?

A 65 year old women with a known history of lung cancer comes to hospital due to hoarseness & difficulty in swallowing. She has no disturbance in vision & hearing. On examination there is loss of gag reflex on left side, when the patient is prompted to say “ah”, the uvula deviates to right side. Her left shoulder is drooped & strength is reduced during left shoulder shrug testing. Chest X-ray shows a right lower lobe lung mass & several osteolytic rib lesions. MRI of head also demonstrates multiple lesions consistent with metastasis. A lesion involving which of the anatomical structure is most likely responsible for this patients symptoms ?
Find out the correct match of drug and it’s side effect.
How many of the following drugs do not improve mortality in heart failure? 1. Sampatrilat 2. Metoprolol 3. Empaglifozin 4. Nesiritide 5. Furosemide 6. Levosimendan
Which of the following is the most potent p-glycoprotein inhibitor?
A patient has been taking steroid inhalers for asthma for years. He notes blurred vision recently. Which of the following findings is likely to be seen in this patient?
Interaction of omeprazole and clopidogrel is based on which enzyme?
Which of the following statements about first order kinetics is true?

options.label: A
options.text: A constant amount of drug is eliminated in unit time

options.label: B
options.text: The half-life increases with an increase in dose

options.label: C
options.text: The rate of elimination is constant

options.label: D
options.text: The rate of elimination is proportional to the plasma concentration

questions.correct_answer: D. The rate of elimination is proportional to the plasma concentration

questions.text: Patient taking an anti-arrhythmic comes for a routine check-up. On physical examination you find this. Which drug was he taking?
Which is the only protease inhibitor that does not benefit from ritonavir boosting?
Which of the following antibiotics demonstrates area under curve dependent killing?
Onodi cells and Haller cells of ethmoid are related respectively to:
Which is not a major criteria for the diagnosis of allergic fungal sinusitis ?

A 25 year old biker met an accident while practicing. He underwent splenectomy and during the surgery 2 units of B positive blood transfusion done. After few days he developed fever with chills and rigor. Clinician suspected this as malaria and ordered a peripheral blood examination which confirmed the diagnosis as Plasmodium falciparum malaria. Read the following statements regarding this condition. I. There is no Exoerythrocytic cycle in this case II. There is no Pre Erythrocytic cycle in this case. III. There is no erythrocytic cycle in this case IV. Sporozoites are the infective stage in this case V. Trophozoites are the infective stage in this case Which of the above statements are correct?

A 16-year-old boy comes to the physician because of recurrent sinusitis that has progressed to a pulmonary infection with left-sided chest pain and fever. One year ago he had an episode of Staphylococcus aureus pneumonia, and he had repeated oral candida infections until a few years ago. He also brought a HPE report as shown in the image. Which of the following would confirm the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Large lysosome vesicles in neutrophils on light microscopy

options.label: B
options.text: Low fluorescent activity on dihydrorhodamine (DHR) flow cytometry assay

options.label: C
options.text: Low levels of IgM, IgE, and IgA

options.label: D
options.text: Positive nitroblue tetrazolium dye reduction test

questions.correct_answer: B. Low fluorescent activity on dihydrorhodamine (DHR) flow cytometry assay

questions.text: A 35-year-old man is HIV antibody positive and has a CD4 count of 50/mL. He has had a fever of 101°F for a few weeks and “feels tired all the time.” He has no other symptoms, and findings on physical examination are normal. Complete blood cell count, urinalysis, and chest X-ray are normal. Blood, stool, and urine cultures show no growth. A bone marrow biopsy reveals granulomas, and a culture grows an organism that is a budding yeast at 37°C but produces hyphae at 25°C. The Hyphae morphology shown in the image. Choose the

In the laboratory, a virologist was studying the properties of mutant viruses. When she infected cells with mutant virus A, no progeny viruses were produced. When she infected cells with mutant virus B, no progeny viruses were produced. But when she infected cells with both mutant virus A and mutant virus B, progeny viruses of both virus A and virus B were produced. Which one of the following is the term that best describes this phenomenon?

A 48-year-old man comes to the hospital due to 10 days of persistent fever, chills, fatigue, and dyspnea. He had a splenectomy at age 28 after a motor vehicle accident and received the appropriate vaccines. The patient does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs. He recently travelled to Connecticut for a family wedding. His temperature is 38.60 C, blood pressure is 118/70 mm Hg, and pulse is 108/min. Lung examination reveals coarse crackles. Chest x-ray reveals bilateral infiltrates. A peripheral blood smear is shown in the image. Thrombocytopenia, elevated LDH, also present. The vector responsible for this patient's current condition can also transmit which of the following organisms?
In a patient who is having anxiety disorder, you have prescribed propranolol. Which of the following statement is least likely to be correct for propranolol in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: It helps in specific anxiety provoking situations

questions.text: Patient on USG had Bosniak Type 3 Cyst and CECT was done for evaluation.

A 45-year-old Male presented with ataxia and urinary incontinence. He has been unwell for 6 months when he developed forgetfulness and was labelled as having dementia. 2 months later he also noticed imbalance while walking. He is obese and smokes 10 cigarettes/day for last 15 years. MRI shows dilatation of ventricles with effacement of sulci and gyri. What is the diagnosis?

A 50-year-old male comes with chronic diarrhoea and memory loss. He is a chronic alcoholic and smoker. He noticed 6 kgs weight loss in last 3 months and has not taken any multivitamin supplements. He underwent a duodenal biopsy which shows PAS-positive organisms. What is the diagnosis?
A patient developed loss of sensation at the root of base of penis after laparoscopic hernia surgery. Which of the following nerve would have been damaged?

A 25-year-old male comes with cough associated with sore throat and fever since 3 days. He also noticed passing blood in the urine. However his Serum creatinine is normal and Serum complement levels are normal. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following is false about Meckel’s diverticulum?

options.label: A
options.text: Tc scan detects meckle’s with ectopic gastric tissue

options.label: B
options.text: Bleeding Meckel’s is best diagnosed by Tc RBC scan

options.label: C
options.text: Angiography is usually diagnostic as Meckel’s has its own blood vessel (persistent vitellointestinal artery

options.label: D
options.text: Meckel’s is persistence of distal part of persistent vitellointestinal duct

questions.correct_answer: D. Meckel’s is persistence of distal part of persistent vitellointestinal duct

questions.text: A patient of RTA with grade III splenic trauma is admitted in your ward. He is on nonoperative management. What would be the reason for laparotomy on second day of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Fall in Hb from 12 to 10 gm/dl

questions.text: All of the following are different types of perfusion scintigraphy except:
questions.correct_answer: A. Tc RBC labelled MUGA scan

questions.text: Which of the following isotopes of iodine is used in brachytherapy?
Which is the first visual field defect to be seen in glaucoma?
Which of the following is not a cause of Wormian bones on X-ray skull?

Read the following assertion and reason. Assertion: Tc sestamibi scan is investigation of choice to localise parathyroid adenoma. Reason: There is differential uptake of Tc sestamibi by parathyroid cells.

options.label: A
options.text: Assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Assertion and reason are true and reason is not the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is true but reason is false

questions.correct_answer: C. Assertion is true but reason is false

questions.text: In which of the following stages of neurocysticercosis can ring-enhancing lesions be found? Calcified stage Vesicular stage Granular stage Colloidal stage
What does the arrow marker part of the waveform denote?
Discriminative touch sensation is due to which of the following?
Positive lumen gradient for absorption of divalent ions in thick ascending limb of loop of Henle, is maintained by recycling of which of the following ions?
Which of the following decreases amplitude and frequency of contractions in rabbit intestine bathed in Dale’s solution?
Which of the following is not a mechanism of autoregulation of renal blood flow?
Dilatation ahead of a bolus of food is due to which of the following?
questions.correct_answer: A. Anterograde relaxation by VIP release

questions.text: A 76-year-old lady sustains a slip and fall at home in her washroom. She has been complaining of severe pain and swelling in her hip and groin area. On thorough examination, it is found that she has shortening of approximately 3.5 cm in her lower limb and lateral border of her foot is seen touching the bed sheet. Which of the following is the best treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Internal fixation with cancellous and cannulated screws

questions.text: An 8-year-old child sustains a fall from height while playing on the roof. He develops gross swelling over the right ankle. He is taken to the doctor where X-rays do not show any bony fracture and the child is managed conservatively. The child develops calcaneovalgus deformity 2 years later. What was missed at that time?
questions.correct_answer: B. Salter Harris type V trauma

questions.text: What should be the treatment of this condition in a 9 month old child?

options.label: A
options.text: 2 lakh IU oral vitamin A at 1,4,16 days

options.label: B
options.text: 1 lakh IU oral vitamin A at 0,1,14 days

options.label: C
options.text: 1 lakh IU oral vitamin A at 1,4,16 days

options.label: D
options.text: 2 lakh IU oral vitamin A at 0,1,14 days

questions.correct_answer: B. 1 lakh IU oral vitamin A at 0,1,14 days

questions.text: The test shown below is done for?
Which of the following is false for the given image?

options.label: C
options.text: The corneal curvature of horizontal axis would be more

options.label: D
options.text: -4DC at 180 degrees will be the refractive spectacles given for this patient

questions.correct_answer: D. -4DC at 180 degrees will be the refractive spectacles given for this patient

questions.text: A 40-year-old female complains of blurry vision in both eyes, particularly in the morning. She went to see the doctor who told her it could be a corneal dystrophy. Which is the likely diagnosis?
Botulinum toxin B acts by cleaving which of the following?

A 35-year-old female presents with abdominal pain and weight loss for 3 months. Over the past 2 weeks, she has noticed yellowish discoloration of her sclera and dark yellow urine. She also has been unable to sleep lately due to severe itching of her palm and soles. Blood investigations reveal random blood glucose of 188 mg/dL. Suspecting possible pancreatic adenocarcinoma, you get an abdominal CT which is shown below. Which of the following statements is false?

options.label: A
options.text: This patient is likely to develop Riedel’s thyroiditis

options.label: C
options.text: There is involvement of peri-pancreatic fat

questions.correct_answer: C. There is involvement of peri-pancreatic fat

questions.text: A 51-year-old male presents to you with left heel pain. His X-ray is shown below. What is the diagnosis?

A 2-month-old child is brought to you by his mother with failure to thrive. He was recently admitted for an episode of pneumonia. His mother explains that the child starts sweating while she breastfeeds him. On examination, you not hydrocephalus. What is the next step in management?

A 3-year-old child is following up with you for his recent diagnosis of epilepsy. On his latest scan, you note progressive atrophy of his left lobe of brain. He does not have any cutaneous lesion on his face. Which of the following is false about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is mediated by anti-mGluR3 antibody

options.label: B
options.text: There is compensatory hypertrophy of the skull

options.label: C
options.text: There will be late onset calcification of the gyri

questions.correct_answer: C. There will be late onset calcification of the gyri

questions.text: Which one of the following is the diuretic of choice in patient with hepatic cirrhosis and ascites?
In which of the following dose does dopamine act on beta1 receptor?
Weakly acidic drugs binds with which of the following protein?
Which of the following is not a component of HDI?
A new drug launched in the market reduces mortality but doesn’t cure the disease. The drug will have which of the following effects?
Strength of association between exposure and outcome is best given by?
The recent increase in non-communicable diseases is an example of which of the following?
Arrange the causes of neonatal mortality in order? A. Sepsis B. LBW and Prematurity C. Congenital anomalies D. Birth trauma and Asphyxia
Match the following regarding the lifecycle of JE:
The label on a brand says it contains 500 mg paracetamol but it actually had 200mg paracetamol. These type of drugs are :
Which of the following viruses has endogenous transmission in India?

A 26-year-old pregnant female was diagnosed with leprosy and started with multi-drug therapy for treatment. After 3 weeks of treatment, she notices the development of new, erythematous and painful lesions on her arms. What is the next step in management?
A forest worker has a history of warty/cauliflower lesion on foot. A biopsy of the lesion is as shown. What is the diagnosis?

A 24-year-old female experiences abdominal distention, nausea, cramping, and pain followed by a watery diarrhoea after consuming skimmed milk and yoghurt.. This set of symptoms is observed each time this meal is consumed. What is the likely diagnosis?
A patient has lesions as shown. Patient mentioned that a spider crawled in that area while sleeping. The diagnosis is:
A 10-year-old female presents with difficulty in getting up from a chair and lesions on the hand as shown. The diagnosis is:
questions.correct_answer: B. Gottron’s papule in Juvenile dermatomyositis

questions.text: Which of the following is a parametric test of significance?
The maximum age of administration of DPT vaccine is?
Which of the following is not a speciﬁc protection method under primary level of prevention?

options.label: A
options.text: Rifampicin to close contact meningitis patient

questions.correct_answer: B. Health education about hand washing

questions.text: It is well known that DNA polymerases synthesize DNA only in the 5' to 3' direction. Yet, at the replication fork, both strands of parental DNA are being replicated with the synthesis of new DNA. How is it possible that while one strand is being synthesized in the 5' to 3' direction, the other strand appears to be synthesized in the 3' to 5' direction? This apparent paradox is explained by

options.label: D
options.text: Replication and immediate crossover of the leading strand

questions.text: WHO recommended mass drug administration is indicated for all except?
Which of the following is transmitted by vector shown in the ﬁgure?
A patient presents with tachycardia, increased BP, tremors, auditory and visual hallucinations, hepatomegaly and is disoriented to time, place person. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a small round blue cell tumour?
Match the following translocations with the lymphomas:-

An 8-year-old child presents with pain, redness and swelling over his right thigh since the past 2 weeks. He is unable to bear weight on his right leg. On examination, his HR is 110/min, BP is 90/60 mm Hg and temperature is 102 F. Which of the following translocation is seen in the diagnosis?
Arrange the sequence of the events in the cell cycle. 1.Cyclin D – CDK 4 2.Cyclin A- CDK 2 3.Cyclin B – CDK 1 4.Cyclin E- CDK 2

On the cardiac histopathology of a 52-year-old patient undergoing post-mortem, the following finding is found. Which of the following is another finding that is most likely to be found in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Systolic anterior motion of the mitral valve

questions.correct_answer: C. Silver wire appearance of retina

questions.text: Read the following statements. 1. Doxycycline can be given for the treatment of Onchocerca volvulus. 2. Wolbachia is a symbiotic bacteria in filarial worms, but has no role in filariasis pathogenesis. 3. Mazotti reaction is seen in lymphatic filariasis. 4. Filariasis patients with lung involvement lack other manifestations of filarial disease. How many of the above statements is/are incorrect?

A female infant is born with an omphalocele that was diagnosed antenatally. The infant was delivered vaginally at 38 weeks' gestation. Birthweight was 4500 g. The omphalocele was covered with a clear polythene film after birth and the baby has been admitted to the nursery for intravenous 10% dextrose while awaiting surgical consult. After insertion of the peripheral intravenous cannula a venous plasma glucose is collected and is 1.1 mmol/L. The baby's core temperature is measured at 36.0 °C. Which one of the following is the most likely cause for the plasma glucose reading?
A 1-year-old boy undergoes exploratory laparoscopy for an impalpable right testis. Intraoperatively, he is found to have blind-ending testicular artery on the right. What should be the next step?
questions.correct_answer: B. Do nothing else and close

questions.text: Chromosomal mutations can be identified by all methods except?
Restriction enzymes have which one of the following characteristics:

options.label: B
options.text: Generate either staggered (sticky) or blunt ends upon cleaving DNA

options.label: D
options.text: Can cleave different DNAs only once

questions.correct_answer: B. Generate either staggered (sticky) or blunt ends upon cleaving DNA

questions.text: Which of the following is true about eukaryotic transcription?

options.label: A
options.text: Is independent of the presence of upstream sequences

options.label: B
options.text: May involve a promoter located within the region transcribed rather than upstream.

options.label: C
options.text: Requires a separate promoter region for each of the three ribosomal RNAs transcribed.

options.label: D
options.text: Requires that the entire gene be in the nucleosome

questions.correct_answer: B. May involve a promoter located within the region transcribed rather than upstream.

questions.text: Xanthurenic acid in the urine is suggestive of deficiency of which vitamin?
Inner mitochondrial membrane contains a transporter of?

An 8-year-old child with no history of vocal abuse presented with the chief complaint of hoarseness of voice for last 3 months which is progressively increasing in severity. His parents give history of repeated episodes of breathlessness since the age of 7 years. Child was sent for endoscopy which reveals multiple small papillomas along vocal cords bilaterally as shown in given slide. Which of the following is not appropriate statement regarding diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Intralesional Cidofovir is helpful to reduce the recurrence rate

options.label: C
options.text: Microlaryngeal surgery with CO2 laser is the primary modality of treatment

questions.correct_answer: D. It’s a purely glottic entity

questions.text: A 18-year-old man presented with left sided ear discharge for 1 year with dull ear ache. On examination left tympanic membrane is thickened and chalky white in appearance and a mass is seen in the posterior canal wall on left side. What is the diagnosis?

An individual is brought to casualty with complaint of headache, drowsiness, anxiety, photophobia. On examination he has extrasystoles, gynaecomastia and trigeminal neuralgia. What could be the possible cause?
Which of the following findings is not suggestive of female skeleton?

options.label: A
options.text: Prominent sacral part of chilotic line

questions.correct_answer: A. Prominent sacral part of chilotic line

questions.text: A 40-year-old Japanese tourist comes to your clinic with severe headaches, palpitations, burning and pain in his hands since the last 5 days. On examination, you notice erythema and peeling of his hands. His BP is 160/100 mm Hg and HR is 115/min. You also notice a strawberry tongue. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following IPC is mentioned incorrectly?

options.label: A
options.text: Sec 316 IPC – Preventing a child from being born alive

questions.correct_answer: A. Sec 316 IPC – Preventing a child from being born alive

questions.text: Arrange the following in the order of putrefactive changes. 1. Brain 2. Uterus 3. Heart 4. Larynx 5. Muscle
Which of the following is not true about malignant otitis externa?

options.label: A
options.text: It is caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa

options.label: B
options.text: Gallium scan is used for diagnosis while ESR at 2 weeks is prognostic

options.label: C
options.text: It can cause skull base osteomyelitis

questions.correct_answer: B. Gallium scan is used for diagnosis while ESR at 2 weeks is prognostic

questions.text: A 32-year-old male comes to the emergency with acute onset severe pain in his right eye and blurring of vision since the past 24 hours. He also complains of flashes and floaters. On examination, he has keratoconjunctivitis. A slit lamp examination reveals uveitis. A fundoscopy is performed and is shown below. On asking, he reveals that he has dated several men before and does not use condoms regularly. What is the diagnosis?
All of the following are used to test colour vision except?

A 60-year old man presented to emergency with chest pain, radiating to the left arm for last 15 minutes. Blood examination shows normal levels troponin and creatinine Kinase enzymes. The doctors at the emergency room successfully save the patient with treatment. If it would have been possible to examine microscopic sections during the episode which of the following would have been most likely cellular change?

options.label: A
options.text: Cell swelling, pyknosis, swelling of endoplasmic reticulum.

options.label: B
options.text: Cell swelling, membrane blebs, membrane damage.

options.label: C
options.text: Cells swelling, membrane blebs, hydropic change.

questions.correct_answer: C. Cells swelling, membrane blebs, hydropic change.

questions.text: A 50-year-old man had surgery 3 months ago. Now he has a small 0.3 cm nodule beneath the skin at the incision site that was sutured. Which of the following cell types is most likely to be most characteristic of the inflammatory response in this situation?

A 58-year old man presents with epistaxis. Biopsy from the mass shows small round cells centred around the blood vessel. Immunohistochemistry shows the neoplastic cells are CD45 (LCA)+, CD3-, CD4- CD20-, CD16+, EBV+. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: B. Extra nodal NK cell lymphoma

questions.text: Which of the following is involved in formation of d-TMP from d-UMP?

After a long workout, a third-year medical student drinks a bottle of glucose and electrolyte containing sports drink. Which of the following is a major mechanism for absorption of glucose from the small intestine?

A 65-year-old man is suffering from congestive cardiac failure. Tests by the cardiologist reveal a right atrial pressure of 10 mm Hg. An increase in which of the following would be expected in this patient?
The airway pressure of a normal 77-year-old man is approximately 1 cm H2O during expiration. What is his airway pressure during inspiration?

A 35-year healthy man had a snake bite, he was administered polyvalent anti Snake Venom (ASV) and was discharged from the hospital after a week. Three days after discharge he develops high grade fever, arthralgia, lymphadenopathy, facial swelling and erythema in hands and feet. Which of the following explains the manifestations?

A 38-year-old lady presents with easy fatiguability, peripheral blood examination shows Hb 8 g/dl, MCH 27, MCV 80 fL, RBC count 2.9 million, reticulocyte count 0.5%. Which of the following is likely a diagnosis in this case?

A 33-year-old woman presents with a diffuse scaly skin rash of 4 weeks duration. Biopsy of skin lesion reveals mycosis fungoides. Which of the following IHC markers would be most useful for identifying malignant cells in the skin of this patient?

A 26-year-old primigravida visits your office in the 12th week of pregnancy. A routine CBC is as follows: Haemoglobin 12 gm/dl, haematocrit 45, reticulocyte count 1.8%, RBC count 6.5 million and a peripheral blood smear shows microcytic hypochromic picture. Serum iron is 90 ug/dL and serum ferritin is 80 ug/dL along with a TIBC of 300 ug/dL Which of the following is the most appropriate step to be taken?

A 70-year-old woman complains of a throbbing unilateral headache and vision problems. She reports weight loss and mandibular pain while eating. The patient also has a history of recurrent bouts of fever accompanied by malaise and muscle aches. Which of the following is not true about the condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Raised ESR is a common finding

options.label: D
options.text: Fragmentation of internal elastic lamina is seen

questions.text: A 13-year-old female patient presented to the emergency with acute diffuse abdominal pain for the past 12 hours.. A tense sausage shaped mass is felt in the upper abdomen. Gums and lips show dark spots. Further investigations reveal multiple sessile and pedunculated polyps in the GI tract. A biopsy performed showed a characteristic histopathological appearance of arborizing smooth muscles and glands. The family was then counselled about risk of breast and pancreatic cancer in the family, and screening of other members as well. Which gene mutation was found?
Which of the following drugs would be best to use to treat irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) in a 58-year-old woman?
A woman who is undergoing an endocrine work-up to diagnose the cause of a large multinodular goitre develops atrial fibrillation. Which of the following would be best to treat this arrhythmia?

A 36-year-old man has been smoking two packs of cigarettes a day for the last 20 years. He is concerned that his health has deteriorated, and he has a persistent hacking cough. He also states that he doesn’t want to “get lung cancer and die, like my father did.” He has tried nicotine patches with no success and wants to know if there is any “pill” he could try. What medication could the physician recommend?

An 76-year-old woman who is taking multiple medications for her “heart disease” is prescribed gentamicin for diverticulitis. After a few days of taking the antibiotic, she complains of dizziness and tinnitus. What “heart medication” might she be on?

Intravenous administration of epinephrine to a patient result in a severe decrease in diastolic pressure and an increase in cardiac output. Which of the following drugs might the patient have previously taken that could account for this unexpected effect?

A 54-year-old man with poorly controlled diabetes mellitus is brought to the emergency department. He was unconscious and hypotensive when found, but in the ED he is alert and complains of severe abdominal pain and shortness of breath. The patient is also febrile and has sinus tenderness with erythema in the paranasal sinus, and a bloody discharge around his nose. He states that he has had double vision for the past 3 days. Physical examination shows that he cannot move his left eye in any direction. Which of the following is the most likely causal organism?

A 30-year-old NRI missionary who recently returned from a trip to South America presents to the clinic with symptoms of high fever, headache, and back pain. Physical examination reveals yellow pigmentation at the conjunctiva of the eyes, and the patient vomits during the visit. The vomitus contains dark-colored blood. Results of a reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction test are positive. Which of the following viruses is a member of the same virus family as the one most likely causing this patient's disease?

A 50-year-old man begins to have profuse, non-bloody, watery diarrhea 2 days after arriving from Bangladesh to serve as an aid worker. A stool sample looks like water after rice has been cooked in it, and a smear shows no WBCs. His mucous membranes are dry, and his skin shows signs of tenting. Subsequently, electrolyte abnormalities develop that lead to cardiac and renal failure. What is the mechanism of action of the exotoxin produced by the most likely causative organism?

options.label: A
options.text: Directly acts as an adenylate cyclase

questions.text: After 11 days in the intensive care unit following an automobile accident, an 18-year-old woman develops increased urinary urgency, burning during urination, and lower abdominal pain. When her urine is cultured, a red pigment is observed in the Petri dish. What is the most likely organism causing these symptoms?

A 9-year-old school student is brought to her pediatrician with complaints of fever, cough, and fatigue for the past 2 weeks. The physician notices that the patient is having intermittent bouts of many coughs in a single breath, followed by a deep inspiration. Choose the correct toxin.
A vaccine is given in some parts of country to prevent acute encephalitis syndrome. According to UIP which of the following is true regarding the same?
questions.correct_answer: A. Live attenuated and subcutaneous route

questions.text: Which of the presenting symptoms of an intracranial complication of sinusitis, in the order of most to least common, is listed below?

options.label: A
options.text: Purulent rhinorrhea . Fever . Headache . Altered mental status

options.label: B
options.text: Fever . Altered mental status . Purulent rhinorrhea . Headache

options.label: C
options.text: Headache . Fever . Altered mental status . Purulent rhinorrhea

options.label: D
options.text: Altered mental status . Purulent rhinorrhea . Headache . Fever

questions.correct_answer: C. Headache . Fever . Altered mental status . Purulent rhinorrhea

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman has relapsing remitting multiple sclerosis. She has experienced two attacks of disease previously that have left her with residual lower extremity weakness. She was initially treated with glucocorticoids with some improvement in her symptoms. However, she is currently only able to walk with a rolling walker for about 100 m. A prior antibody test shows that she is positive for reactivity to the JC virus. You are planning to start a disease-modifying therapy. Which of the following is least appropriate for this individual?
Testicular tenderness is a feature of which vasculitis ?

30-year-old male presented with haemoptysis and RPGN. He is a smoker and does not give history of previous similar episode. Renal Biopsy reveals Linear Ig deposits on the GBM. The most likely finding on serology is antibody against:
questions.correct_answer: C. Alpha 3 subunit of type 4 collagen

questions.text: Following are the causes of enlarged kidney in CKD except?
Which of the following gastrointestinal disorders is often associated with Sjogren syndrome?
All of the following are branches of the anterior division of the internal iliac artery except?
A patient is given the tetanus toxoid vaccine after an injury. Post vaccination, the nurse noted some asymmetry of the shoulder. Which of the following structure is involved?
If cytosine in DNA is deaminated, the uracil residue that results may be removed by?

A 32-year-old man was brought to the emergency department after he was hit by a truck while walking. His HR was 119/min and respiratory rate was 26/min. His Chest ̣X-ray is shown below. Which of the following would be contraindicated to do in this patient?

A 22-year-old lady presents with a hematoma over the right arm region following a history of stab injury. Radial and ulnar pulses were absent on the right side. A 3 cm longitudinal tear was noted in the brachial artery. Which of the following statements is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Primary repair with prolene sutures is the procedure of choice

options.label: B
options.text: Repair with reverse saphenous graft is preferred

options.label: C
options.text: PTFE graft is the synthetic graft of choice

options.label: D
options.text: Repair with saphenous venous patch is not preferrable in this case

questions.correct_answer: A. Primary repair with prolene sutures is the procedure of choice

questions.text: Identify the following knot.
Which of the following is a false statement about following surgical position?

options.label: A
options.text: This position is mainly used for posterior cranial fossa surgery

options.label: D
options.text: In standard Fowler’s position head of the bed is kept at 45-60 degrees

questions.correct_answer: B. Main complication is CSF leak

questions.text: A patient after sustaining severe chest trauma was brought to the emergency department where he was noted to have dyspnoea, bony crepitus over right hemithorax and paradoxical movement of chest during respiration. During evaluation RR was 36/ min and SpO2 was 60 mm Hg. Which is the best treatment for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Conservative management but strapping of chest should be done.

questions.text: Which of the following is a false statement about aortic dissection?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduction of shearing pressure on the aorta with esmolol is of utmost importance

options.label: B
options.text: Commonest site of intimal tear is within 2-3 cm of aortic valve

options.label: C
options.text: External rupture can cause fatal pericardial tamponade

options.label: D
options.text: Best treatment for type A Stanford is conservative but for type B is surgical.

questions.correct_answer: D. Best treatment for type A Stanford is conservative but for type B is surgical.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about grafts/flaps is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Partial thickness grafts elicit more secondary contraction than full thickness graft

options.label: B
options.text: In partial thickness graft hair follicles are not grafted

options.label: C
options.text: Z -plasty is an example of rotational flaps

options.label: D
options.text: Most commonly used flap in radical neck dissection reconstruction is pectoralis major flap

questions.correct_answer: C. Z -plasty is an example of rotational flaps

questions.text: Which of the following statements about salivary glands is false?

options.label: A
options.text: For Pleomorphic adenoma involving deep lobe, total conservative parotidectomy is surgery of choice

options.label: B
options.text: Most of Parotid stones are radio-opaque

options.label: C
options.text: Adenoid cystic tumour has a tendency to spread along the nerve

options.label: D
options.text: Stafne bone cyst is an ectopic salivary gland

questions.correct_answer: B. Most of Parotid stones are radio-opaque

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about surgical site infection?

options.label: A
options.text: Can occur up to 14 days of surgery

options.label: B
options.text: In case of implants, can occur up to 6 month of surgery

options.label: C
options.text: Staphylococcus aureus is a common cause

questions.correct_answer: C. Staphylococcus aureus is a common cause

questions.text: A 42-year-old lady presented with painful neck swelling for 2 weeks, fever, weight loss, excessive sweating and tremors. Her thyroid profile showed high T3 and T4 and low TSH. Iodine scan showed a cold thyroid. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male patient presented in surgery OPD with complain of dragging pain in lower limb especially after prolonged standing. On examination dilated veins were found without pigmentation, skin changes or ulceration. What is the CEAP classification for this patient?
What is the ideal age of cleft palate reconstruction for residual alveolar cleft?

A known cased of ulcerative colitis presented with pain abdomen, bloody diarrhoea, and fever. His TLC was 16,000. His abdominal X-ray is shown below. He was managed with antibiotics, mesalamine and IV corticosteroids but there was no response after 4-5 days. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: 3rd generation cephalosporin with Anti TNF α agents

options.label: B
options.text: Total proctocolectomy and Ileal pouch anastomosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Total colectomy and Brooke’s ileostomy

questions.text: In a patient with breast cancer, IHC is ordered. For what value of Her 2 neu expression would FISH be done?
Which of the following statements about electrocautery is false?

options.label: A
options.text: For surgeries of the thyroid, bipolar cautery is preferred over monopolar cautery

options.label: B
options.text: In monopolar cautery, cutting is represented by blue colour and coagulation is represented by yellow colour.

options.label: C
options.text: In coagulation mode, cautery is on 6% of the time and off 94% of the time.

options.label: D
options.text: Ligasure can seal up to 7 mm.

questions.correct_answer: B. In monopolar cautery, cutting is represented by blue colour and coagulation is represented by yellow colour.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a perineal repair for rectal prolapse?
Which of the following is not a component of the qSOFA score?

A 60-year-old male patient comes to the outpatient department with complains of blood in urine. On cystoscopy, a 1x1 cm bladder mass was seen. So a TURBT was done which showed T1 transitional cell carcinoma. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Single cycle of intravesical mitomycin C

questions.text: A 32-year-old female presents to you with features of schizophrenia. You start her on haloperidol. Which of the following is the mechanism of intracellular signaling of the receptor this drug acts on?
